1131.content:
You open your eyes. Funny, you don't remember having closed them. You wake up to a small room, containing no more than a small cabinet the simple bed you're currently occupying. Noticing nothing much is happening by way of a tutorial, you stand up and leave the room. You've just passed the door frame when you hear another player materialize on the bed behind you with a soft *pop*. She decided to start out as female you quickly deduce, before watching in amazement as her body quickly twists and changes into innumerable different forms. She starts to grow bright red fur, before it quickly changes to silver, and then it falls out entirely to be replaced by reptilian scales. Her legs merge together into a thick, snakelike tail, then splits into many tentacles before converging back together into a mermaid fin, and finally changes entirely into a tauric lower body.

"Must have bought the deluxe edition with its enhanced character creation", you mumble quietly, before leaving the room and its constantly morphing occupant behind you. Following the corridor, you soon arrive to the sounds of a busy tavern. Before you can enter, you're quickly approached by an npc, a cute cat anthro, who gives you a quick rundown of the game's main mechanics. HP is your health, lose it all and you die. This being a fetish game though, hp damage isn't that common the cat quickly assures you. Besides a few exceptions, monsters will try to incapacitate you by filling your knock-out meter, or draining your willpower. When your knockout-meter gets completely filled, you are rendered unconcious. when your willpower is fully drained, you will be unable to resist your foe's charm until it restores. He also warns against braving foes who are much higher leveled than you. If the level difference is too great, their knock-out damage will start to get converted to raw hp damage. When you question him on skills, he admits he knows only little. The game wishes to reward exploration, so there's no static skill tree to pick from. Instead, you can stumble across them in your adventure, or you'll be given a limited selection to choose from any time you level up. He also grants you some starting gear, which you happily equip.

Gained +1 Leather Tunic
Gained +1 Leather pants
Gained +1 Worn sword
Gained +1 Flimsy Nose Plugs

When asked what your first goal should be, he again repeats that's it's completely up to you. Again though, he warns against starting too much trouble within the city. If things threaten to get out of control within city walls, the game will spawn special guard NPC's to intervene. Players taken by them are never seen again. He continues by saying that most players eventually take a trip to the grand university, to change their body to their liking, but dissuades you from making this your first quest. It can only be done once so you should be explore a bit first, to make sure that you'll be satisfied with the result. Further, it's quite costly, beyond the wealth of a starting player.

He eventually does recommend some courses of action. The first would be to walk around the Citadel to make some money. Plenty of shopkeepers have small and large issues which can only be resolved by a player. Another would be to join one of the city's many guild. Quests offered by them are more risky but carry greater rewards. They also offer a great way to introduce a player to the area around the citadel, though he advises you to always look at the recommended level. Finally, you can mingle with the rest of the players in the tavern. Most only just started their adventure like you, and bonding together will let you overcome tasks you've no hope of beating on your own.

His introductory spiel finished, he quickly moves over to the next player emerging from character creation to repeat it. You look around the tavern, and notice the cat was right. Most players here have the same fish out of water look that you undoubtedly have plastered on your face as well. Hell, many even wear the exact same leather outfit you are! Oddly enough, you only see a couple pure humans like yourself. There's a good helping of full anthros, some taurs, and even a you-don't-even-know-what-that-thing-is-supposed-to-be, but most of the pink-skinned, furless players have some sort of animalistic ears perched on their head or a tail swaying above their bottom. The deluxe edition must have sold better than you thought...

Closer to the bar, you also see some players who are clearly much more experienced. They seem to be enjoying themselves, observing their newer colleagues emerge from the corridor. You know that in other games, some veteran players go out of their ways to show newbies the ropes. Considering the content of this one however, they might just well be looking for an easy mark to abuse.

You decide you'll...
1131.title: The Capital

11312.content:
You won't make any progress in the tavern. New players would be just as clueless as you are, while those veterans are just as likely to be a threat than a help. You're also not sure you want to start with actual quests in just your starting gear either. It's decided then, you'll take some odd jobs around the city to buy upgrades for your starter set. Then you'll pick your next course of action. Once you exit the tavern, you find yourself in the midst of a bustling city, much grander than that tavern-npc let on. Just looking around you see several other taverns and inns, homes, healers and a circle of wagons circled around what you assume is the main square. Further, you can see the rooftops of many different guild halls, with the spires of what you guess is the famed grand academy far in the distance. Players and NPCs of all shape and sizes crowd the streets, either returning from an adventure, departing on one, or just looking for some fun within the safe(r) walls of the citadel. Walking towards the city gate, hoping you'll find directions to the shopping district there, you manage to catch snippets of gossip from your fellow players. You learn about a dragon, rumored to roost high within the mountains (+2 exp), a farm that mysteriously cut all contact with the rest of society, no one sent to investigate has yet returned (+2 exp), and about the ill fate of a group of new adventurers who specced too much into libido, their leader apparently enslaved by a common chicken (+1 exp).

You arrive at the main gate before long, luckily not having drawn too much unwanted attention to yourself. You quickly make your way to one of the many town maps posted around and happily discover that the city's main storefront is located right next to the main gate. Probably to help adventurers quickly unload any loot they managed to pick up and restock before heading out into the more dangerous wilderness again. You quickly look through the different kinds of stores. There's shops specializing in weapons, equipment, potions, magic, sex toys, a pet store,... Too many to read through, you quickly decide.

You decide to just walk down the street and look around, to see if anything catches your fancy. The first shop that catches your eye, isn't actually one. A large wide barn, with a sign picturing a bipedal lizard riding a bear marks it as the city's stable. You know mounts have got to be expensive, and any job here will thus probably pay well. Then again, most of the work will probably include back-breaking labor, not exactly what you'd imagined doing in a fetish-game. Plus, you only have a strength stat of 5...
11312.title: Head out for the shopping district to make some...

choices: You agree. A chance at one of these things as a mount is too good to pass up.
You decline. as good as getting a mount like this is, it's not worth it.
113121.content:
The smell of a farm, or a zoo, immediately assaults your nose as you step past the wide doors. You'd expected the horses, of pretty much all breeds and coloration, but they've also got some exotic creatures in here! You see a couple of species of bears, some wolves who've clearly grown beyond what's natural, to allow their use as a mount. Further down you see some odd, brightly colored bipedal birds peeking up from their enclosures to take a look at you. Chocobo, you think they were called. And that's just the first aisle, who knows what else they've got hidden in here.

"You lookin' to buy, or just lookin'?" A voice shakes you from your stupor. Seeing no-one around at first, you quickly look down to reveal a goblin girl, her head barely reaching your waist. Her dark hair, black with a purple-ish sheen is held up in pigtails, while one of her lower canines protrudes from her green lips. She's wearing a beige overall with a dirty white shirt underneath. Not wearing any shoes, you can clearly see her four green toes pat against the ground as she waits for your response. "Well?"

"Uh, neither actually" You admit. "I only just started, looking for a way to make some money"."Whelp, best keep lookin then", the goblin bluntly states. "Don't have anythin' to offer ya". "Really, nothing? Don't even need someone to lug the feed around or anything?" You can't fully hide the disappointment in your voice. "Nope, sorry. Can perfectly handle the physical side of things meself. Now, if you're not gonna buy, then could ya- aah? hmm...". The goblin stops mid-sentence as she looks at you ponderingly. "I... may have somethin for ya after all. T'won't be pretty though."

"It doesn't matter, I accept", you quickly state. The green stable master quickly waves away your enthusiasm. "Ye, ye, that's what they all say, 'till they find out what the job entails. Follow me, and put these on." She presses a much more sturdy pair of nose plugs in your hand. You start to worry slightly but obey, quickly slipping them over your nose before dashing after her. She leads you deeper into the barn to a solid door, clearly made from a different wood than the rest of the building. You notice three sets of heavy duty bolts keep the thing locked from your side. "This here's a more recent addition to me shop", she explains nasally, perching a pair of plugs on her own nose as well. "You'll want to keep those on", she points to your set as she unbolts the locks. When the last one is released, the door flies open, nearly hitting you in the face. A rush of hot air bellows out of the opening and... oh gods... You can taste the stink emanating from that room. (+10 KO meter, -5 willpower) The goblin watches you dry heave for a bit with a grin. "Not getting cold feet, are ya?", she taunts, before disappearing into the door opening. You take a moment to steel your nerves before following after her.

"These", she proudly announces, standing before some sort of indoor circus ring. "Are me very own, special edition gasser mounts". You notice the animals here have much larger pens. further, in contrast to thosen you saw before, these are completely enclosed. The thick wooden bars on top of the walls reaching all the way to the ceiling. Even then, they're further separated from you by a second steel fence, surrounding the entire ring. She must have noticed your confused expression, as she immediately launches into an explanation. "Gassers are, to put it briefly, combat mounts. They'll carry ya wherever you need to go, same as their normal counterparts, but they can also charge in to help turn a fight in your favor with their potent stench." "Umm, that's great", you state, still not sure what your job entails. "But what do you need me for?"

"Well, bluntly put, I need ya to let 'em gass ya out", she responds, like it's the most normal request in the world. "...Excuse me?", you respond, astonished by her shamelessness. "Yeah, thought I found a goldmine when I stumbled upon a supplier", she explains. "Trouble is, these are just level ones. they're way to expensive to buy for new players, like yerself, but they're also way too weak to be of any use for more experienced blokes". She shrugs, taking the bad business decision in stride. "But there's a way out of this little shitnugget I found meself stuck in. Ya see, these beauties also get experience and level up if they do well in combat". "So all I need is for ya ta keel over a couple o' times, and they'll be up to snuff in no time", she concludes, brightly smiling at her own genius.

"But I'm only level one myself...", you try, looking for an acceptable excuse to not end up as a fart-cushion for hire."I can't be that useful, right? "Nonsense", she waves your protests away. "There's no better way for a critter to gain exp than by beating a player, no matter the level". Her smile fades, her expression suddenly becoming more serious. "I should prolly also warn ya. Normal mounts are nothin more than meek, dumb animals. These guys though... The game treats em as full-fledged NPC's. They're a fair bit more intelligent and dangerous than their normal counterparts, even without the stink. Ye wouldn't be the first to underestimate a gasser, just to end up huffing on their colon for the next few months. Or gettin' eaten by them."

"You're... not really making the job sound any more enticing", you state, suddenly becoming aware the pens occupants are staring at you in great interest. Some even go so far as to push their buttocks against the bars lining their enclosure, proudly putting their pucker on display for you. (-5 willpower) "Ah, s'only fair ya know what'cha gettin' yerself into", she ignores your worries again. "But how's this fer enticement, ya do a good job on yer first charge, and I'll give ya any one of em ya like". "You'd do that?", you ask in amazement, remembering how much these supposedly cost. "Sure. I recon it'll pay itself back when I'm able to start offerin' custom-leveling gassers as an added service. And, full disclosure, I'm also abit desperate. Had a big client comin in earlier asking for just that service. Was starting to consider divin' under their bums meself to get the job done."

Well, put like that... A combat mount would surely increase your odds drastically. Sure, you'll need to take the increased intelligence into account, but it seems worth the risk. Just... "Say I agree, how exactly am I supposed to get free after they knock me out?" "Oh, I dunno actually...", she casually shrugs. "Honestly don't expect ya to agree, nobody else has. Guess you should lead your charge out into the back pasture for their session, that way they'll come back when they get hungry. Or they'll eventually get bored of ya. Probably." "What about them eating me?", you ask in a panic, remembering her warning from earlier. "Nah, these ones prolly won't. They's well fed, wouldn't want to lose their toy like that."

That doesn't sound convincing at all...

"So, whaddaya say. We got a deal?". She extends her hand with a grin.

▼

HP: 100/100
Willpower: 90/100
KO-Meter: 10/100

Exp: 5/10
113121.title: You enter.

1131211.content:
As revolting as this ordeal sounds, there was no way that you're going to pass up having a powerful combat mount right out of the gate! You eagerly shake her hand, much to her surprise! There's about 7 animals here, and each one clearly smells pretty rank. "So...mind giving me the rundown on all these mounts?"

The goblin nods and approaches the first mount, a normal looking, if a bit big, brown horse. "This here is Brutus. Horses are standard mounts, Gasser or no. Pretty basic stats across the board. They got more stamina than other mounts though. Ya might not get there as fast, but he'll surely getcha there." The horse whinnies proudly, and the goblin girl moves on to the next pen, containing a large deer. "This'n here is Patches. Cervine mounts're usually faster than yer average land mount, and they're real perceptive to danger. They aren't anything overly special as gassers though." Next on the list is a...well...a giant skunk. "Stripes is a Dire Skunk. As you can no doubt imagine, these bad boys reek even when they're not Gassers! They can track any target they've sprayed for up to four days after spraying, and they're the second smelliest Gasser mount overall!" Second smelliest!? What could be worse than a SKUNK!? The goblin moves on to a...well it's probably called a Dire Wolf. "I'm guessing you've already figured that Lobo is a Dire Wolf. Like skunks, they're great trackers, but they're also nice and sneaky! Careful though, their paws reek mighty fierce too." Lobo presses a paw up to the bars, and the smell makes you feel like vomiting! (+5 KO meter.) Next down the line is a strange one. It's a two legged beast with leathery wings. The bottom half is reptilian, and its head looks like a chicken's! It has weird lenses over its eyes too. "Pygmalion is a cockatrice. They're the slowest of the flying mounts, and they don't actually fart, but they've got a bunch of other great features! They can breathe out a green fog on par with standard Gasser farts, and their eyes can either hypnotize or petrify you!" Oh...well that's something! An odd, but useful mount! The next one down the line is one you can easily identify! It's a Gryphon! "Gryphons like Swarm are the fastest flying mounts in the game. They have great vision in the air too. But their bodies can get pretty musky..." The final pen holds...holy crap...is that a freaking dragon!? It's a bit small though. Is it a baby? It also freaking reeks! (+10 KO meter.) "Francis here is a Drake, the most sought after mount in Kinkquest. They're intelligent, magical, loyal, and can speak! They can fly pretty well, and they're also incredibly durable! Gasser Drakes stink all over! Feet, wings, body, ass, everything! They have a special breath weapon similar to a Cockatrice, but it reeks worse than Dire Skunk farts! These bad boys are the best and nastiest!"

With the tour over, you have a job to get to now! You could get the hardest out of the way with Francis, or maybe go for Brutus, who's probably the easiest. Maybe a middle of the road pick like Pygmalion or Lobo would be okay too...
1131211.title: You agree. A chance at one of these things as a...

choices: You cautiously approach. It's what you're here for after all.
You decline, not wanting to enter a small enclosed space with a dragon.
11312111.content:
You look over the cages, carefully considering your options. You can't help it, but your gaze keeps getting drawn to the drake. Even lying down on the ground, gently snoring as he is, he looks imposing. Like he leapt straight from a fairy tale. Dull green scales cover most of his body while the ones on his underbelly are a lighter gray, tapering out around the middle of his tail. Two small nubs sprout from his head, probably the beginning of a fearsome set of horns. While the other animals try to crowd each other out, vying for your attention, he's just calmly resting on the floor of his pen. Maybe the drake would be the easiest option of them all? And if he isn't, just one look at his impressive body tells you you'll need every last bit of strength you have to power through your "training" session with him. Getting past him before exhausting yourself with the other mounts would still be your best choice.

"I'll start with the drake", you state, your mind made up. The goblin looks at you incredulously for a second, before bursting out in laughter. "Hooo boy. Jumping off the deep end, are ya?". Even the drake himself seems surprised by your choice, unfurling his long slender neck to get a good look at you for the first time since you entered. "Whelp, I Ain't gonna try and talk ya out if it if you're sure. 'Course, it goes without saying that we don't accept any responsibility in the case of either partial or complete loss of smell, whether temporary or permanent, nor for any occurrences of devolving into mindless servitude, devourement, etcetera, etcetera...". You're reasonably sure she's just joking. "Well then, you know what to do. Here's the key to his pen. I'll come check on how yer doing in a few hours". "Oh, and Francis", she tells the giant lizard as she turns towards his cage, "Don't be too rough on him alright?". To your astonishment, the drake managed to sneak right up to his pen's bars without making a sound. He looks even more impressive up close like this. Standing up, you're only eye level with the top of his shoulder. Despite his massive size, he' built sleek like a panther. The long neck, about half the length of his body you guess, makes him tower over you. You grow eerily uncomfortable under his penetrating gaze, looking at you like a cat would look at a mouse before pouncing. "You two have fun now", the goblin exclaims, knocking you back to reality as she closes the outer steel gate into the enclosure.

The dull clang of the steel lock shutting echoes around the room for a few seconds, neither you or the drake having moved yet. "So err... Francis", you nervously swallow. "Not going to give me any trouble, will you?" The drake merely grins at this, revealing a muzzle filled with razor-sharp fangs before padding away from the door of his enclosure, his tail swaying playfully behind him. Maybe this won't be too hard after all. The drake watches you fumble for a bit with clear amusement before you finally manage to open his door, the key being a pretty tight fit. As the door slowly swings open, you become painfully aware that nothing is separating you from the drake anymore. It takes a while to calm yourself, Francis thankfully letting you move at your own pace. "Now, let's get you out of here and into some sunlight, alright?" you try to coax the winged lizard from his bed. Some clear air would probably do you good as well, the fumes inside the stalls starting to get to you. (+10 KO meter)

A clearly articulated "No" is the only response you get. You're not sure how to react to that. You'd expected a forceful manhandling or foul scents, not simply a blunt refusal too cooperate. "Err.. Why not?", you try. "I like it here", the drake explains. "The bed is soft and I've enough room to stretch my legs. Outside there are annoying insects and the sun bleaches my scales".

You start to feel like the butt of a great cosmic joke. Here you are, trying to coax a dragon out of his pen so he can stink you into unconsciousness. And he's not even cooperating! "Ah, yes", Francis states, noticing your frustration. "You were hired so we could get stronger by gassing you out, no?". "Well... yeah", you awkwardly admit. It sounds even more ridiculous when said out loud. "Is there a reason we can't just do so here?" The drake calmly smiles at your flabbergasted expression. "Come", he states with a friendly tone "I saved you a spot". He slowly lifts one of his hind-legs, making you blush as he proudly puts his goods on display. Seeing you remain still, he encouragingly pats the spot beneath him, directly under his now raised buttocks. A quick flick of his wing wafts a combination of his musk and stench towards you. (-5 willpower, +5 KO Meter)

"Don't be shy now..."

▼

HP: 100/100
Willpower: 85/100
KO-Meter: 40/100
11312111.title: Francis!

113121111.content:
You let out a sigh as the Drake expectantly watches you. He does have a point...going outside for fresh air would be pretty pointless if you're just immediately going under a dragon's ass. Still, you wanted to at least prolong said ass a bit longer...ah well.

You slowly make your way over to Francis, who grins when he sees that you're complying with him. "Good human. Keep behaving well, and I may just limit you to butt sniffing. Though...I really could use some air under my wings." He flaps them again, blowing their musky stench into your lings. The stink makes you cough, but you don't let it stop you. (+10 KO Meter)

The closer you get to Francis, the more you realize just how much of the stink in here belongs to him! By the time you've laid yourself beneath his rear end, you're regretting every life decision you've ever made, since they all contributed to you arriving at this point in your life. Rank, swampy sweat drips down from Francis' ass, and the second you close your eyes to keep it out, he slams said ass down on you! The humid, horrid smell of his unwashed ass makes you feel sick to your stomach! He could probably knock you out with this alone! (-5 Willpower, +10 KO meter.) Of course, there's no way that Francis is letting you off that easily. He rubs his ass on you for a bit, just to demean you and grind the smell in, and then...he lets it rip! A trumpeting blast of hot wind hits your nose, and with it comes the absolute WORST smell you've ever experienced! The goblin girl was not kidding when she said drakes...s...smell the...w-worst...out...o-ooooooooo... (+40 KO Meter
Status: Knocked out!) You go limp and unconscious beneath him, only to wake up to the sight of...

HP: 100/100
Willpower: 80/100
Knocked out!
113121111.title: You cautiously approach. It's what you'...

choices: No such luck, you get to enjoy an extended stay with the drake.
1131211112.content:
Your eyes flutter open, giving you an unobstructed view of the barn's roof. With a groan, you sit up again, seeing Francis fiddling with something near the door. "Oooh... Did... Did it work?" you ask, still groggy from his potent stink. "Hmm?", the drake responds.Finished with whatever he was doing, he pulls the door to his pen shut. "Oh yes, I believe I gained two levels at once thanks to that. Though the next ones should come slower due to me outlevelling you now." "W-Wel, I'm sure we'll manage", you stutter, nervous to see him pull your sole exit shut. "I should probably check in with the stable master to tell her the good news". "Ah, I was afraid we'd run into that little problem", the drake states, turning around to face you. "You see, us dragons have an annoying habit of being fairly... possessive", he explains with an apologetic smile while slipping the tip of his tail between the bars. "And well, you felt rather comfortable to sit on. I don't think I want to share you with the rest of the creatures here quite yet".

With a whip of his tail, you hear the key turn inside the door's lock, sealing it with a soft *clack*. Then, you watch in horror as the key is pulled free from the door with a quick flick from the agile tip, sailing through the air before softly landing on the ground, well out of arms reach. "Now then, where were we...". He casually saunters towards you with a grin, and you can feel his stench growing thicker as he comes closer. (+10 KO Meter) You frantically scramble backwards, trying to put as much distance as possible between you and the smelly dragon. Your back soon hits the wall of his enclosure, letting the dragon close the remaining distance with just a couple of steps. The drake rears up to his full height when he stands directly before you, clearly enjoying how he towers over your frightened form. "Tssk, tssk", he playfully scolds. "Did you forget you have a job to do?".

He slowly lowers his neck downwards, until his head is at eye level with you, your noses a hairs breadth apart. Your eyes grow wide as he slowly, deliberately opens his great jaws. His thick, forked tongue slithers along the bottom of his mouth, as thick strands of saliva ooze down from the roof. For a second, you seriously fear he's planning to eat you as the stale stink of his breath wafts towards you. (+20 KO meter) But instead of feeling his jaws close around you, you hear a deep, wet growl from deeper inside him. His esophagus briefly twitches before a thunderous belch erupts from the back of his throat, enveloping you in the sour stench of digesting meat. (+30 KO meter)

Still reeling from his belch, you don't see the drake suddenly whips his head towards the door, looking alarmed. "Hmm, we're going to have to cut our fun short", he softly states to no one in particular, before grabbing your leg and pulling you away from the wall. The sudden move causes you to slide back fully on the ground again, a position Francis quickly exploits by lying on top of you once more, your face comfortable nestled beneath his buttocks again. (+10 KO meter) You understand the drake's sudden actions as you hear a familiar voice call out, muffled through the drake's butt. "Player, ya still conscious?". The goblin! She'll rescue you! You first try to push the dragon off, but he's way to heavy. "Gosh darnit Francis, you didn't scare him off, did you?". She sounds much closer this time, probably right in front of the pen. Can't she see you underneath the drake? Or... Shit. He must be deliberately using his body to hide you from view! Trying to free an arm or leg from under him is also no option as he expertly has them pinned beneath his talons. Out of options, you try to yell. "I'Mmmf-", is all you manage to get out before the agile tip of the dragons tail pushes you firmly against his wrinkled anus, smothering the rest of your shout into his fetid bowels.

You hope the small bit of sound you managed to get out was enough.
1131211112.title: His face!

choices: "I'll make due with the gryphon. IF your employee trains her too"
11312111122.content:
"Did you say something Francis?". You're completely immobilized now, desperately praying she'll find you lying here. Your heart flutters as you hear a familiar *clack*, signaling the lock just got opened again. Your hope sadly gets blown away as the wrinkled hole covering your face suddenly blows open, dousing you in the smell of the beasts rotten colon once more. "Ah for fuck's sake Francis, no wonder he ran off", is the last you hear before you slip back into oblivion. (+40 KO meter) [Status: Knocked out!]

...

You awake with a groan, head still pounding after you got a front-row seat for the drake's flatulence. You see the door is closed, the opportunity to escape having passed. The drake himself lies on his mattress, curled protectively around you. "...Why?", is all you can manage as you slowly come to grips with the fact you're stuck here for who knows how long. "Hmm?", the drake sleepily groans, unfurling his long neck to look at you. "It's as I said, we drakes are possessive of our hoards", he states matter-of-factly. "But...I'm not some object you can claim as yours!", you explode, before quickly flinching back, fearing the dragon's retribution. Instead, he just offers you a gentle smile: "Sure you are. You're my very own little exp booster" You're... not certain if that was meant to be a joke or not. "Besides, I know I can't keep you here forever. Just... a while longer."

You dejectedly slump down, not seeing a point in pushing the issue any further. "Next time she comes down, I'm going to make sure to scream in time, you know", you offer, weakly trying to mount some kind of resistance. "You could", Francis admits. "Ofcourse that just means that next time, I'll need to hide you inside of me instead of simply underneath", he tellingly pats his belly as he says this, the scaled surface giving an ominous rumble in response. A cold shiver runs down your spine as you mentally measure yourself against his gut, deducing that you'd probably fit, albeit barely. "Just... forget I said anything".

You just sit there in silence for a while, unsure what to do. Luckily the drake just lets you be for now, content in the knowledge you're not getting away. You start shivering as the afternoon sun slowly sets, chilly evening winds whipping through the barn from time to time. "You know, the nights can get pretty cold down down here...", Francis breaks the silence. You look back to glare daggers at him, but freeze when you see he's shifted to lie on his back. Arms, legs and wings splayed wide open in a wordless invitation to you. "Want to cuddle?", he playfully offers. You're about to tell the dragon where he can stick his offer, when another breeze cuts straight through you. Wordlessly, you shimmy closer to the scaled beast, his face immediately lighting up. Once you're within reach, you feel his powerful arms close around you, cradling you like a teddy bear. Then you're hidden from the outside world again as his wings close over you, surrounding you completely with his body. Your scaled cocoon quickly fills with the drake's scent, trapping you with his stink as you slowly slip into dreamland.

...

And so your stay with Francis begins. At first you attempt to keep some track of the time you're imprisoned by the smelly beast. However, you quickly realize this is almost impossible due to the frequent periods you are rendered unconscious as Francis intimately introduces you to every part of him. The goblin was right, every single part of him gives off an unbearable stench. But you quickly start to notice it's not the same stink all over. Your prolonged encounter with him allows you to pick up different tones of his rancid aroma, oozing from different parts of his body. The hind paws smell more like moldy cheese, while his front ones carry the sharp sting of vinegar. His butt and pucker carry a thick cloud of near unbearable rotten nastiness while most of the rest of his body has a comparably lighter, more subtle stink. His breath is mostly stale and wet with a sour undertone, the latter smell originating from the organic processes deep within his body occasionally vented out in a thunderous belch. The wings have a more stinging, acrid smell while his genitals, to your surprise, don't even really stink at all. Instead, they carry a potent musk that easily overwhelms you with its raw masculinity, making your head swim after just a couple of whiffs.

Ofcourse, the drake soon discovers this new skill of yours, and quickly turns it into his new favorite game. It involves having you close your eyes and smothering you with a body part, with you having to guess what it is. Guess wrong, and he'll keep you buried beneath it until you fall unconscious. Guess right and he'll switch body parts, until you either guess wrong or can no longer continue playing because you've fallen unconscious. He seems to get really into it, scolding you like a disappointed parent on any wrong guess and getting giddy with excitement whenever you get it right.

Days slowly lose their meaning to you, your normal schedule of wakefulness and sleep being at the mercy of the drake's whims. As time slowly inches past, you notice his smells slowly get stronger, thicker, more potent. You get a perverted sense of satisfaction as the drake continues to gain levels, knowing you are the sole cause of his growth. For food and drink, you share the bowls which were meant for Francis. He gets to dine first, naturally, allowing you to pick up the leftovers after he's had his fill. There's an unusually large amount of drool coating the food and water whenever you get to it, but you're unsure if it's just another game of his or if he's just a messy eater. In either case, you know bringing it up couldn't do you any good and the small scraps he leaves you, leave you too famished to be picky.

The goblin stable master still often comes down, mostly to clean the area or to feed the mounts, occasionally to offer some other poor sap the same deal she gave you. Ofcourse, with the drake's not-so-subtle threat still fresh in your mind, you make no more attempts to get her to notice you, obediently lying down beneath the dragon whenever you hear the door starting to get unlocked. Your hope of getting saved still flares up though, only to get dashed whenever you hear those bolts close again, the sound muffled through the scaled beast.

Until one time when, after the drake took his favorite seat atop of you, you hear the visitors approach much closer than is usual, to the middle of the gasser pens. "Well, here they are...". "Hmm... A pretty limited selection", comes a voice you don't know. "Have you managed to get any of them leveled, as I requested?" "Not... Not yet...Only one who showed any interest so far, bailed on his first day" "Well that's disappointing... Still, I'm here now, might as well look at what you have on offer. Hmm... Horse's too common... Skunk too unpredictable... Cockatrice too slow... Say, is that a drake I see over there?" You feel the wall of muscle covering you tense suddenly, while you're barely able to contain your excitement. "Looks pretty young, but has a decent build... This trip might've been worth it after all, Emi. Can you call him over, I'd appreciate a closer look" You'd be jumping in joy if you didn't have several hundred pounds of dragon lying on top of you. "Well... Alright. Gotta say, he can get a bit skittish though. Francis, C'mere you. Let the nice kitty have a look at ya." You felt you scaled tormentor hesitate for a bit, but, knowing the jig was up, he decided to sit up straight, revealing your legs to the world as your face got pushed even further up his ass.

"... Emi, would those legs belong to that bailed help of yours?" "What in... Player! What're you doin' under there?" Stargazing, you mentally answer, any actual sound you made getting muffled by the beast's malleable buttocks. "Francis! Get yer big butt off him right now! I swear, I've half a mind to sell you to a shoe store. You can't just go kidnappin' my employees whenever you feel like it!" Slowly, and very reluctantly, you feel the great scaled ass lift off you. Only slightly, requiring you to slide yourself from under the dragon. An opening you quickly make use off before desperately bolting to the pen's door. "Now, now, Emi. There's no need to be so harsh. Look on the bright side, if this player truly spent all this time underneath this drake, he must be pretty well leveled by now", the cat-anthro speaks without regard for your well being. Only seeing him for the first time, you see he's mostly gray with black striped. A white tuft of fur sprouting underneath his shin. He wears an elaborate red, feathered had and a similarly colored suit, the back of the vest splitting in two just above his tail, two sides trailing down to stop just above his knees. His feet are enclosed in shiny, black knee-high boots.

"Does that mean...?" "Yes, you've more than held up your end of the bargain. I'll pay full price for the drake. Even throw in a small bonus"

"I decline", Francis quickly cuts the the deal making short. "The player first chose me as his mount, I wish to stay with him."

The cat didn't look happy at this bit of news. After a brief consideration, he turned back to Emi.

"Well then..."

▼

Being stuck with the drake for so long has greatly taxed you!
HP: 40/100
Willpower: 50/100
KO-Meter: 70/100

You've grown more used around bad smells!
You've gained the skill:
Sturdy Sniffer - all stench-based damage is reduced by 10%
11312111122.title: No such luck, you get to enjoy an extended stay...

113121112.content:
"No thank I don't think I want a drake anymore" you said

"Shame" said Francis "I was looking for a new butt cushion"

You look around again after exiting the drakes cage and locking it.

Many you should try someone else, you thought

You look around and spot the dire skunk starring at you
113121112.title: You decline, not wanting to enter a small enclo...

11312112.content: Many you should choose someone else?
11312112.title: Are you sure?

choices: Stuck deep in the wolf's ass!
Still in the indoor ring with the wolf!
Somewhere in the Goblin girl's barn!
11312113.content:
You decided it would be best to go with one of the weaker creatures. You look over the gigantic wolf and notices his fur pattern being similar to that of a grey timber wolf. You couldn't help but to notice that he has quite a gut on him. And as if the wolf knows you are looking over him, he decides to turn around and shows you his furry butt...You blush deeply looking over it. The butt cheeks are a bit chubby, but have a bit of muscle in them. You then look under his tail and see his huge pucker...the hole looks like it would have no trouble sucking you in...and you couldn't help but to gaze at the wolf's rear some more...

"So have you decided yet?" The goblin interrupts, causing you to get spooked. You then look over at the big wolf more before making your decision.

"I'll start with the wolf" the goblin then chuckles for a bit before she speaks again "Figured you would!"

"Before you start, it should be noted that we don't accept any responsibility in the case of either partial or complete loss of smell, whether temporary or permanent, nor for any occurrences of devolving into mindless servitude, devourement, or being stuck as an anal toy..." You gulp hearing all that and then nod at her.

"Ok well, here's the key, and just holler if you need anything else!"

You nod again before the goblin girl left and you start to unlock the pen. The wolf sees you and starts to wag his tail, seeming to be happy you have picked him. You notice a strong smell as you get into the pen and lure the wolf out (+10 KO Meter). As you walk the wolf out into the middle of the ring, you couldn't help but look up at his chubby butt again as it sways as he walks. The wolf notices this and noses you, snapping you back out of it before getting into the middle of the indoor ring with the wolf.

You then get behind the wolf just as he lifts up his tail, exposing his huge pucker.

"Ok so, how do we st-" Before you could finish, the big wolf sits down over you, gently pinning you under his furry butt. Just as the wolf gets comfortable, you immediately pick up a strong smell from the wolf's pucker (+5 KO Meter)! You blush at this and as you gently push against the chubby butt cheeks, a small puff of gas seeps out. (+10 KO Meter) You gag a little and weakly push up against the wolf's butt cheeks. The wolf then lets out a deeper moan as a much louder fart slips out (+25 KO Meter).

You kept blushing and wiggling under the wolf's butt as he continues to gas you (+10 KO Meter). You continue to take in his gas...(+5 KO Meter) just before you are knocked out by his potent farts (+10 KO Meter)!

Sometime later, you wake up from your gas induced sleep, coughing as the wolf's fumes were still around you...

You look around and notice that you are...
11312113.title: Lobo!

11312114.content: Maybe you should chose someone a little more smeller
11312114.title: Are you sure?

choices: You pick stripes for a smelly adventure
113121141.content:
You look at the most beautiful creature you have ever seen. A giant smelly skunk

You have always had a thing for skunks. The look of the giant fluffy tail that came out of his backside
Made you want to just fall asleep it it

“Ah, I see” said the goblin girl “you like the look of stripes do ya, well this is no ordinary dire skunk, no siree this one I found near an abandoned wizards tower. The wizard was trying to combine all his magic and all the special powers of a drake like talking and halitosis into him to create the perfect pet to satisfy his smelly fedish. Fortunately for the skunk it was a total success he gained magical powers, the ability to talk, produce horrendous halitosis that could rival a dragon itself and increased all his stink capabilities. Unfortunately for the wizard he ended up killing himself in the process, leaving this smelly skunk to wander until I found it

You looked back at stripes and he looked back at you

“I think that I’ve chosen the mount that I want to train and take”

“Really?” The goblin said looking up at you “just o you know he smells even worse than the drake over there” she said pointing over to where the drake was laying

You think it over in your head

On one hand you could have the smelliest of all the mounts to help you on your quest
On the other hand if you weren’t careful he could take advantage of you and gas you out for all eternity
113121141.title: Stripes

choices: Ambushed! A Prostitute NPC forcebly drags you into an alley!
113122.content:
You decide against looking for entering the stables. You just didn't have the stats to work there effectively. Besides, taking care of horses isn't what you were playing this game for anyway. So, you just move on.

The next store to catch your eye is a place called "Kissandra's" Apparently, it was a store that sold magical lipstick that applied special effects to the wearer's kisses. There was actually a 'Help Wanted' sign outside that explained they were looking for someone to test the effects of new lipstick on as well as be a practice dummy for customers to test their wears before making a purchase.

Now this seemed more your speed. Not only would you spend the day getting kissed by women, but your (relatively) high Intelligence meant your Willpower would recover faster, allowing you to do more "work".
113122.title: You continue onwards.

choices: Time to head in this mysterious place!
Time to chicken out and walk down the mountain!
1133.content:
As you decided to choose the starting area, you thought to yourself, trying to guess all the logical outcomes with your new brain! "If I decide to pick these woods as a starting area,who knows what might happen to me inside that place!" You decided to play it safe and your skinny hand was about to touch the Capital starting area, after all...you would need better items and information starting out this unknown game...but just as you were about to touch it, you heard an amazing voice say "Come to my temple young one, You might be the one I am seeking."

Just like that the voice vanished as quickly as it appeared. You had no idea how to respond, but it seems this voice had power,beauty and the intelligence to back it up!

You decided to click on the now shimmering mountain starting area, and you felt yourself get dragged into the game! Once you woke up, you were completely naked and tried to cover yourself with your weak hands until...you looked up and saw a wonderful temple made out of gold and tons for shiny glittering gems! You stared at it's beauty for a while, amazed at it...when you noticed that there was a large crystal door right in front of you! It felt like the place was calling for you, begging for you to come inside...But should you go inside? After all seeing all these statues of a weird creature around you...made you rather nervous.
1133.title: The Temple of a Goddess!

11331.content:
Even if this place was a trap, it was extremely cold and snowy up on the mountain, and you started the game with no clothes! You push the doors open and hurry inside without a second thought! The inside of the temple was warm, no doubt from the many torches along the walls. In this main room, you see a few robed figures bowing in front of an even bigger, person sized, statue of the creature. Each person takes a turn kissing the statue's feet before standing up and walking away. As the final person does so, they notice you watching them!

The hooded individual pulls back her hood to reveal a white furred mouse girl. "Welcome to the temple of the Goddess. Have you come to pay your respects? Become an acolyte? Become a slave to the Goddess?"

You give her a confused look. "Goddess? Is that what all the statues around here are? I just came in because I was...drawn here. Also it's cold outside."

The mouse girl seems a bit shocked that you don't know who the Goddess is. But, after a few seconds, she pieces it together. "OH! You're the player! Chose to start on the mountain, hm? Well, that's a fantastic choice! We acolytes are pledged to the great Kitsune Goddess first, it's true, but we are also to obey the Player, so long as he partakes in the ceremony."

You raise an eyebrow, "ceremony? What ceremony is that?"

The mouse girl seems excited to tell you, "oh! It's a one of a kind experience! First, you'll smell the statue's feet. And I hope you aren't disappointed, but they won't smell as strong as the Goddess herself. Anyway, once the smell makes you fall asleep, your soul will be uplifted to the Goddess's domain. If you worship her enough to please her, she'll pleasure you and give you her mark, and we'll do as you say! If you fail, you'll be sent back, and we'll have no choice but to execute you via either sex draining, vore, or the Chamber of Lethal Stench."

Wait, so you had to worship this smelly fox deity well, or be executed!? That didn't sound too appealing at all... "And what if I refuse to do the ceremony?"

The mouse girl's smile fades, "you'll be branded as a heretic and public enemy. You'll be made into a slave for us acolytes. A win-win for us, really. I could use a foot licker, and a new sex toy."

With all the options on the table, you...

HP: 100
Willpower: 100
11331.title: Time to head in this mysterious place!

113311.content:
You carefully consider your options. Submitting to these acolytes as their plaything is out of the question, especially considering the mischievous grin the mouse girl gave you when not-so-subtly offering you a position as her foot licker and sex-toy. Attacking doesn't seem wise either. You've got no equipment whatsoever, and are heavily outnumbered within the temple. Running sounds decent, but risky. You've played enough games to know members of religious orders tend to be capable spellslingers. If you run, a single root or slow would all but guarantee your enslavement.

"Fine", you sigh, unable to think of any other options. "I'll take part in the ceremony."

The mouse girl's ears droop down at your response. "Oh." she states, her excitement visibly deflating. "Very well, follow me please."

The disappointment is audible in her tone. You realize with a start she's walking away from the kitsune statue in the entrance hall, and quickly run after her. "I'm sorry but... is something wrong?" you ask confused, "and isn't the statue back where we came from?"

"Oh no, that one's mostly decorative. The statue used for the ceremony is deeper inside the sanctum.", she explains, "And no, nothing's wrong. It's just that,... well...". She abruptly stops, turning around to face you. Her ears are laid back on her head and she's holding the tip of her tail in her hands, nervously fidgeting with the pink appendage. "I've only recently been granted the privilege to keep my own slave, and when I saw you walk up... Not even an NPC, but an actual player!... My hopes got the better of me... I should have realized any player would choose to sacrifice themselves to the goddess over willingly submitting themselves to enslavement by a lowly acolyte NPC like me..."

Her casual suggestion that you don't stand a chance at surviving the ceremony shakes your confidence slightly (-5 willpower)

"Come on, don't take it personally", you begin, "I'm sure you'll find a lucky player to smother underneath those pretty feet in no time", you awkwardly try to cheer up the would-be mistress somewhat, unable to stand seeing the cute rodent sad like this. "Besides", you continue, defending yourself from her implication, "You're making it sound like I've already failed."

"You really think so?", she perks up, quickly gazing down at her toes with a smile before continuing: "Well..I guess it's not completely impossible... But think about it. Our Goddess is the main deity of this world. She's got thousands, maybe even millions of followers across the realm. This temple alone houses over a hundred of her servants, each having fully devoted their lives to worshiping her. Meanwhile you..." she briefly pauzes, before continuing, "Don't take this the wrong way, but you're not even twenty minutes out of character creation, you don't possess any items, potions or spells. You don't even have a single experience point to your name yet! What do you think our odds are?"

Shit... laying it out like that, you don't have a snowball's chance in hell of making it through alive. Your confidence weakens further (-10 willpower)

You continue the rest of the walk in silence. At first, you were slightly excited at the prospect bedding a goddess, despite the awful consequences should you fail. Now, your mood has turned more somber, you feel like you're being led to the gallows. The brilliant carvings and tapestries coating the many winding halls your guide leads you through do nothing to alleviate your spirits. The few other temple inhabitants you meet regard you with a pitying smile, though one spontaneously bursts out in laughter as she sees you walk by. (-5 willpower)

"We're here", the mouse girl announces, stopping before a pair of enormous ornate doors. Their surface is covered in intricate decorations, centered around an enormous nude kitsune nearly as tall as the doors themselves. She seems to be smirking down at you, sending a cold shiver down your spine. The mouse girl silently pushes the great doors open to reveal a garden, completely encircled by the temple. Two willows stand to the side, and you can also see a large pond directly on the opposite side. At the center of the garden stands a giant marble statue of a kitsune, the same one featuring prominently on the doors. This one was much larger though, you estimate you're only as tall as her knee! The statue carries a soft, gentle smile, and is holding her arms open in a loving embrace towards you and your guide. This time, she is also fully clothed, wearing a flowing kimono stopping just above her ankles. The statue's feet are contained in a pair of ebony, open-toed sandals. Her many magnificent tails trail gracefully behind her as one.

"Alrighty", your guide shakes you out of your stupor, "You know what to do.". "Just put this on first.", she states handing you a ceremonial robe from one of the several cabinets lining the garden. You obey, happy to finally get some form of clothing. It's completely white and soft as silk, fitting loosely around your body like a bathrobe. You thank the mouse girl, before quickly jumping back with a shout as you look at the statue again. The kitsune's pose has completely changed. Instead of looking slightly towards the sky with closed eyes, the demi-fox now stares intently downwards, stright at you! The soft smile is replaced with a toothed grin and her hands, no longer lovingly embracing the air, now firmly rest on her hips. Her tails have fanned out far and wide, almost like a peacock, making her look that much more imposing. The biggest shock however, is the empty sandal beneath her. Her left foot has liberated itself from the shoe, and is now resting in front of her. Just its heel is touching the ground, with the rest of the foot slightly lifted, presenting its sole to you. Her big toe, the size of your fist, has parted from its siblings, exposing the smooth crevasse between them. For a second, you swear that you saw a drop of liquid roll down the sole before it's hidden from view. A soft breeze blowing from behind the now menacing statue carries an odd smell towards you.

"Well.." your guide starts again, seeing you've frozen up once more, "Best not keep her Holiness waiting". "Go get her, tiger", she mocks, before giving you a firm push in the back, forcing you closer to the marble giantess.

"W-Wait!" You panickingly exclaim, quickly taking two steps back from the malicious statue. "Myeeesss?", comes the mouse girl's sugar-sweet response.

You'll have to be careful here. One wrong word and you'll get enslaved for life, or worse.

"You were right", you begin. "There's no way I can hope to succeed in pleasing the goddess as I am now". "But!", you quickly cut off the rodent's response. "I also don't want to be branded a heretic either. I do intend to complete the ceremony, just not yet."

"Hmm", the mouse seems to consider your words. "But we can't let you leave the temple untill you do. It's the rules"

"Then I'll stay on temple grounds", you quickly continue. "In exchange for room and board, I can do all kinds of tasks around here. It's what us adventurers are for, right?". "There's just one more thing I'll need as well..." you try, encouraged by the acolyte's silence. "I need you to help me practice in pleasing the Goddess, for when I do continue the ceremony"

"You expect me to help you with that!?", the rodent yells in surprise. "Well, yeah. There's no way I'll ever become able enough on my own", you confidently reply "And if I don't even have a chance of ever succeeding, I might as well just continue now". "And...", you keep pushing, feeling you're close to convincing her, "while I'm sure your order is looking forward to ending me through sex, vore or that chamber thingy, those executions are reserved for those disappointing the goddess, right?"

"Well yes", admits the mouse-girl, unsure where you're going with this.

"I, on the other hand, won't just be disappointing.", you cockily continue, "it's like you said, I'm hopeless, haven't even gotten my first point of experience yet. It's not hard to think the Goddess would not just be disappointed by me, but feel insulted that I was even sent to meet her. And if death is the punishment for disappointing her, what would the punishment for a willful insult be?"

The mouse girl looks up at you in silence, her jaw slowly dropping at the sheer shamelessness of your logic. Still, it's clear you've struck a nerve (+5 exp)

▼
HP: 100/100
Willpower: 80/100
Exp: 5/10


Your charisma is being tested!
113311.title: Proceed with the ceremony

choices: Start preparing you for the ceremony!
1133111.content:
"I... guess I hadn't thought of that", the mouse girl silently admits. "Still, you'll need to join our order if you want to stay here for longer. And you'll need to find a higher ranking member of the clergy to help you in your preparations.", she concludes, "I'm still only an acolyte, I wouldn't be allowed to have another member as my subordinate..."

"Fine, I think I can live with that", you respond, happy to have gotten a stay from execution. "Where would I be able to find someone to...". You're interrupted when a soft glow surrounds and envelops you, something you instinctively recognize as the game's achievement system. For a brief moment, you see a phrase appear in front of you: "Player - Honorary Temple Acolyte" (+10 exp). You look back to your guide, only to watch in amazement as the same light circling her as well! She seems as confused as you are, looking at you in a panic as the light fully consumes her.

The glowing orb quickly shrinks down untill the mouse's outline becomes clearly visible once more, acting like a radiant, skin-tight body suit. Then, Your jaw drops as, slowly, you see her clothes start to change. The rough tunic she wore before elongates in a gracefully flowing cotton robe while a pair of soft, ornate slipper materialize around her feet. A quick glance above the mouse's head confirms your suspicion. Her previous designation of acolyte has disappeared. Instead, it now proudly states: Clergy Member.

"Oh, I know exactly where you can find someone to teach you", she begins as the glow finally dims, her voice dripping with giddiness as you stare at her dumbfounded. "In fact, I even know she can't wait to begin your lessons, my dear acolyte", she finishes, slowly walking towards you with a confident smirk as she carefully enunciates your new title.

"Wha... How...", you stammer, throwing some quick glances at the menacing fox statue, no longer sure if falling into this anthro mouse's clutches is preferable to disappointing a goddess. The rodent's sudden domineering attitude crushes your spirit. (-5 willpower)

"Does it matter?", she casually waves your objections away, "This is what you wanted, right? To have a taste of temple life before undertaking the ceremony?". I'll make sure you'll get to experience it to the fullest... Meanwhile, I'll get what I wanted as well", she purrs, standing directly in front of you now, confidently staring right into your eyes. "How did you word it again? Finding my very own player to smother beneath my pretty paws, right?", she finishes with a predatory grin, lifting one of her footpaws from its slipper, before seductively running it down the side of your leg. You can feel the clammy sole stick lightly to your skin as her long, slender toes curl around your ankle. (-10 willpower)

"But first", she sighs, "I'll need to visit the head-mistress to fill in the needed paper work for our new roles. Go to my room and wait for me there, please".

You quickly obey, happy to take any excuse to get out of that accursed garden. Oddly, you don't have any issues finding the mouse's room, even though you have no idea where it is. You open the door to reveal a small, single person bedroom. A lone window opposite the door gives a breathtaking view on one of the mountain's glaciers. To the right of the window, in the room's corner, is her bed. It's definitely not luxurious, but seems comfortable enough with a feathery pillow and a thick straw-filled mattress resting on a sturdy wooden frame, covered by heavy sheets. On the wall, at the height of the foot of the bed, hangs a poster in a language you don't recognize. It's got several numbered entries on it, making you guess these are probably the goddess' commandments. The opposite wall is mostly hidden behind a large bookshelf and a sturdy desk, containing several pieces of parchment, an inkwell, and an unlit candle. The last wall contains, besides the door you just entered through, a wide closet. One door is slightly ajar, revealing several sets of robes. A spare pair of sandals rest on the ground before the closet. You can clearly see the dark imprint of the mouse's feet on the insole, evidence that these have been with her for a long time.

With not much else to do, you pick up a book from the shelf. Luckily, this one seems to be written in english, and you go sit on the bed to read...

...

You've learned a new spell!

Mental Hitchhiker: range - 10m. You can project your mind into someone else's body within range for up to one hour. During this time, your own body is unconscious. You can not control the body you enter, you are merely an idle passenger along for the ride.

...

It wasn't easy, but you've done it! you've learned your first bit of magic! (+7 exp)

You're just about to start on the next chapter when the mouse-girl enters her room, looking exhausted. "Phew... That was way more burdensome than I thought it'd be..."

"But with that out of the way, let's properly introduce ourselves", she continues with a tired smile. "I'm Alice, and I'll be your mentor and direct superior during your stay in our temple."

"I'm Player", you say, standing up from the bed, extending your hand.

"And that brings us to rule number one", she states happily, "When greeting a superior, you should bend down and kiss their feet". You cock an eyebrow, but she doesn't seem to be joking. Slowly, you bend down to your knees. You can see her coat of fur stop just above her ankles. This close to the rodent's feet, you notice a faint aroma of cheese and vinegar waft up to greet you (+5 to knockout meter). You quickly plant a kiss on the top of her foot. Immediately, you can hear her little claws dig deeper into her slipper's sole as her long, slender toes involuntarily clench at the feeling of your lips grazing against the sensitive skin.

Your cheeks burn as you stand back up (-5 willpower).

"Don't worry, you won't need to spend the entire day on your knees kissing the feet of anyone walking by", she tries to reassure you, "It's mostly a sign of respect. But you are expected to greet your superiors properly when they take you aside for a one-to-one conversation like this. The same thing applies when you walk past any statue of the goddess".

"Now for the practical side of things", she continues, clearly in a better mood than when she walked in, "You're free to stay in our temple for as long as you wish. However, you have to complete the ceremony successfully before you'll be allowed to leave. I won't repeat the consequences of getting caught while trying to escape", she states sternly. "Each day you'll get a list of tasks. Then after dinner, if you've completed them, I'll help you prepare for the ceremony, alright?"

"Depends, where does being smothered underneath your feet fit into that planning?", you blurt out before you can stop yourself

Now it's Alice's turn to blush. "I... may have worded that a bit poorly earlier", she admits. "But you have to understand, our goddess' scent is extremely potent. As you are now, a singly whiff would outright kill you before you even got within arms reach of her. Part of your training will be to endure sensations that would easily overwhelm you right now.". "And, well...", she nervously continues, having started to fidget with her tail again, "The best way to increase your endurance is by exposing you to these sensations...". She trails off at the last bit, unwilling to look you in the eye as she makes clear exactly what she has planned for you.

"Fine", you relent, steeling yourself that this will only be temporary. "So, where do I sleep, and what are the plans for the rest of the day?"

"You can sleep with the rest of the acolytes if you wish, there's enough beds in the shared dormitory. Or you could... umm... sleep in my room", she nearly whispers the last bit, her blush returning full-force. You look back questioningly at the bed, which is clearly meant for only one person.

"Oh", she exclaims, picking up on your doubt, "I'm sure we can improvise something...", with a rush she's rummaging through her closet, throwing three stacks of spare blankets on the ground next to her bed. She quickly arranges them, one being used for a mattress, another for its intended purpose, while the last gets folded in half to serve as a pillow, as she looks at you sheepishly.

"I... guess I'll decide later.", you say, not wishing to offend the mouse anthro. "And what for the rest of today?"

"Well, neither of us have any tasks yet, so I thought we could..."

▼
HP:100/100
Willpower: 60/100
Knockout meter: 5/100

Exp: 22/10

Spells: Mental Hitchhiker
1133111.title: Success!

choices: "To lie down so I can ride you!"
"To let me sit on your face!"
1133112.content:
The mouse only has to think about it for a moment before shaking her head and laughing right in your face! "You REALLY think that's going to save you, player? The Goddess loves to torment players, regardless of how long they last! No matter the level, you're her favorite kind of plaything! The only difference your lack of experience makes is that she'll probably kill you with her stink before we have a chance to!"

Your heart sinks as the mouse laughs in your face, and when you turn back to face the statue, it's now winking at you and pointing at the huge stone sandal beneath its foot! This...this is bad...

The mouse girl puts her hands on your shoulders and starts pushing you towards the sandal! "Come on, don't keep the Goddess waiting! If you do, you're dead for sure! Last player who backed out once the statue got into the ready pose had a sock suddenly conjured upon his face! He died in one sniff!"

That little story makes you pick up the pace alright! You start walking on your own until you're standing in the statue's sandal! Its massive foot hovers just above you, making you feel..well...small.

"Great!" The mouse exclaims. "Now just lie down and close your eyes! Don't be surprised if you start doing weird stuff." With no other choice at this point, you obey the mouse's instructions. You lie down underneath the statue's sole and close your eyes only to feel it suddenly press down on your body! Weirdly enough, it doesn't seem to stink like the mouse implied. "What happens no-ohwhowoah!" Suddenly, you find yourself humping the statue's foot! Your cock rubs up against the smooth stone and a powerful tingling sensation flows through it. This feels amazing! Whatever force that was making you hump the sole fades away, but now you're doing it of your own volition. "Mnmgh..." It feels so...so good! Feet...feel...amazing! Those thoughts fill your head as the goddess's magic floods your mind, tampering with your psyche!

"Perk" Acquired: Footjob Addiction

Just as you're about to blow though, something in the air changes. You take a small sniff and...HOLY CRAP THAT REEKS! You start to retch and wheeze as the overpowering stench of this statue's foot fills your lungs! It's so...so...s...

You wake up in what appears to be a lavish bedroom. Gold-trimmed furniture adorns the entire place and various trinkets of tribute adorn said furniture. On the bed lays an absolutely gorgeous Nine Tailed Kitsune! Your heart starts pounding the moment you lay eyes on her, and before you even realize it, you bow before this beautiful woman!

Status Inflicted: Infatuated

The Kitsune goddess rises from her bed and stands over you. "Mmm...well at least you know your place! I'll make this simple for you, dear. You have to survive a day as my slave. If you die, well...you'll be dead! If you simply break beyond repair, I'll restore you, send you back down to my temple, and...well...you know the rest!"

That's it? Just spend a day worshiping this absolutely beautiful woman? You can do that! No prob-

"My my, confident, aren't we? Need I remind you that you passed out after one measly sniff of my statue? If you do, by some miracle, survive a day under me, you will receive my blessing! As such, you can either become a paladin fighting in my name, a high priest who can demand things of all lesser beings, or...my undying, immortal lover."

Lover! Lover! You couldn't imagine being apart from he-

"That's what they all say at first, darling. But notice how I'm alone in this room? They all change their tunes...usually within the first hour! Now, enough talking! I want you..."
1133112.title: Failure...

114.content:
The screen makes a slight adjustment as you pick your starting attribute.

Human Male Player
Health: 100/100
Willpower: 100/100
Strength: 5
Intelligence: 5
Charisma: 5
Agility: 15
Libido: 0
Exp: 0
Skills: None

You hop up and down, and stretch a bit. You feel like you could run a marathon! You look up to see your final selection...your starting area. You get no information on each one other than the name, but you can figure out what each has pretty easily. You choose to start in...
114.title: Agility

1142.content:
You decided to start at the Woods. You figured it wouldn't be that bad, because why would they make a dangerous area a starting place? Besides, you could move fast. You could easily avoid any monsters if you were careful enough. Upon making your choice, any light around you warped. What used to be normal light turned into pin-point lights that zipped past you as you suddenly shot through space. And, just like that, you were suddenly surrounded by trees.

Yeah, trees. It wasn't exactly remarkable, though that may be one of the biggest dangers of forests. Everything looks so similar, you forget where you were. Who knows how long it could take you to get out of here. Well, first things first, you needed to focus on a direction.
1142.title: The Wild Woods

11421.content:
You have no real context for which direction will lead to something good, but as long as you keep heading in a single direction, you'll be out of the woods in no time! You use the rising sun to figure out which way is North, and sprint off in that direction! As you rush through the woods, you manage to slip past a huge bear, a harpy, and some kind of giant Venus flytrap! By this point, you've gone far enough to earn 10 experience points! You decide to stop for a moment and figure out what to do with your first skill point. Given that Agility is your main stat, sneaking seems like a good bet! As soon as you think that, text pops up in front of your face declaring [Acquired Sneak lvl 1].

You're about to start running again when your ears pick up the sound of...talking? Well, time to put that new skill to use! You creep over to the source of the sound, and the voices start to become more distinct.

"You shoulda surrendered at the start! I don't appreciate it when a mark gets all uppity about being robbed. Luckily, I know just what to do with you!"

"Oh, what, are you going to eat me? Fart on my like the disgusting freak you are?"

You peer through the bushes to see what all the fuss is about. There's a small camp in a clearing. A menacing looking anthro Skuntank woman is standing over a red fox lady who's been stripped naked and tied up. The Skuntank is nude too, but that's probably by choice. There's also a horse with pristine white fur and a green saddle next to the Skuntank.

"Oh, I'M not going to fart on you. My horse is!"

The fox woman looks at the equine, and her eyes widen in fear when she sees the green saddle. "Oh, oh fuck! She's a..."

"Yup! I've got me a Gasser mount! Lucky you, she's just shy of being a high enough level to kill you with farts, but you'll be sleeping a long time!" The Skuntank steps out of the way, and the horse steps up and presses its ass to the fox girl's face. The horse lets out a whinny, and before the fox girl can beg for her life, it blasts her with a toxic, sulfur reeking, mind-blowingly awful fart! The fox girl's eyes roll back and she near-instantly faints from the overwhelming stink! As the stench wafts over to you, you feel a little woozy yourself! (+40 to Knockout meter). You unthinkingly let out a cough, and...

HP: 100
Willpower: 100
Knockout Meter: 40/100
11421.title: You go North

114211.content:
You duck down, cursing under your breath. You hope that cough didn't just mess everything up, but it doesn't take long for the Skuntank to spot the skulking rogue hiding in the undergrowth. Her horse is still admiring its handiwork on the fox lady. With a big smile the anthro Pokemon calls out to you.

"Well I'll be damned. It must be Christmas, 'cause I just found myself another adventurer to shake down. Stay right there, unless you wanna end up like ma other mark here." She points over her shoulder to the unconscious fox woman. "You might think of running, but rest assured I can go a whole lot faster thanks to my equine friend here. And she really works up some gas when she's gotta chase someone down."

Her little monologue gave the stench in the air time to dissipate, allowing your head to clear. [-10 to knockout meter] Your adventure only just started, you couldn't let her take all your things already. Both the Pokemon and her mount seem versed in knockout farts. Your next possible customer is a blue-haired kitsune who appears to be involved in the city’s administration. “We rely on farmers in the region to provide this village most of its food. “I’m going to get the deed to this place. I guess that means I’m your new owner, huh?” You ask, and the stallion nods. “I guess that means I’ll have to come up with a name. Hmm…” You start brainstorming names. You’re not very good at names, of course, so you just base it on his fur color like you did with Silver. “How about… Smoke?” The horse whinnies in affirmation, and you chuckle. “Oh, you like that name, huh? Smoke it is, then!”

Later, Kuzuru walks out of the farmhouse donning her kimono again, her skin and fur pristine as ever. She seems a little upset that she’s gotten rid of her natural stench, but once she works up a sweat, she’ll be back in business. As she walks back over to you, she sees you riding out of the stalls on Smoke’s back. Even Silver manages to sit on the massive horse’s back, though you have to hold onto her to keep her from slipping off. “Oh, you’re gonna keep the horse? That’s smart, I guess. That thing’s a super high-caliber gasser mount,” she says.

“Hop on! There’s more than enough room,” you say, patting the spot behind you. With a sigh, she jumps up onto the stallion’s back beside you, wrapping her arms around you as the horse starts galloping towards the village.

┄┄┄


Later that night, you and Kuruzu stumble into the tavern, to see that blue-haired kitsune sitting in the corner. He seems surprise when you walk up to him and slam a bag of thousands of coins down on the table. “Here’s your damn coins,” you glare at him. “Now why didn’t you warn us that a demon ruled over that entire farm?”

He gives you a weird look. “I was aware of no such thing,” he said, nonchalantly. “Everyone I’ve sent to investigate that farm never returned.”

“Then why didn’t you tell us that?” You growl. “The fact that nobody’s ever returned alive from that farm seems like pertinent information!”

“Because if I told you that, you wouldn’t have gone,” he said, and you’re filled with rage. You almost died because of this asshole, and he doesn’t even care? “Now, I will hold up my end of the bargain and provide you with your reward. Fair?”

“Oh, no. 200 Gold would be my reward if there were only a few rogue farm animals,” you almost snarl. “I’d say vanquishing a demon entitles me to a bonus, don’t you think?”

He raises his hands, trying to calm your temper. “Now, calm down, human. I didn’t hire you to vanquish anything. I only hired you to collect on a debt… and that’s what you did,” he said. You were so angry, you wanted to punch this bastard! He can’t seriously believe that 200 gold was worthy compensation for the nightmare you just went through? “However, I do know a group of people who would handsomely reward you for having vanquished that demon…”

You calm down slightly, intrigued. “Who?”

“The Demon Hunter Coven, up in the citadel,” he explained, pointing out the window to the mountains. “If you can bring them proof you’ve vanquished a demon, why, they’d reward you with all the fame and fortune your heart desires.” You consider it while he pulls out a sack of gold and a slip of paper. “Alright, here. 200 Gold and the deed to the farmstead, as I promised. Are we done here?”

You look over your rewards, and sigh. “Yeah, we’re done here.”

With that, you stumble out of the tavern, exhausted and ready to go home...

You begin at the summit of the mountains, at the back door of a monastery dedicated to the eternal fox goddess. It's often said that every follower should make a pilgrimage to meet her, but only the most dedicated too! She always had a taste for young men too, perhaps with her blessing, she could become a powerful prophet! She also lured some up the mountain to sate her tastes, but that was for the low commoners, to please her base interests...you would be a true disciple, perhaps an equal to her intellect if not her divinity. It's a long journey up the mountain, but to worship a goddess would make it more than worth it!

After a few moments in the hole, you realize that the tunnel goes deeper into a small, but cosy chamber. You peek your way in and see a snow white rabbit boy on top of a bed of soft leaves. Naturally, being enclosed in this small space combined with his sensitive sense of smell and especially hearing, the sleeping bunny stirred, and stared up at you. It was winter, had you disturbed his hibernation? The rabbit suddenly jumped up with incredibly agility you couldn't keep up with, and threw you from the ceiling tunnel into his chamber! You faceplanted into the straw, and looked up at the boy you were stuck with.

A snow white rabbit boy with only a black splodge over his left eye. As you were looking up you noticed that the hole was the only way out...you were trapped with him now. The bunny kicked you onto your back and began squashing your chest with his large floppy foot. A gross scent wafted up to you, the whole chamber smelled like it now that you noticed. "Who are you? A hunter! Looking for my pelt?! He rubbed his foot against your wool robes. "Hm...doesn't feel like fur..." You came clean immediately, not having the charisma to think up an effective lie. I've been hibernating for a while...and there have been things I've not been able to do, give me these things...and you can stay until the spring as my...guest!"
