The first thing you did upon entering Kinkquest was head to the Alteration lab to change your form. You already had the perfect body in mind. Back on Earth, you were just a homely, chubby woman in her 30âs, your youthful beauty slowly faded. But in Kinkquest, you were a gorgeous, 8-foot tall anthro with glistening white scales. You had a pair of small, useless leathery wings folded behind you, like a dragonâs; but you also had a long snout, full of jagged teeth, just like an alligatorâs. Your body was still very pudgy, but now, it was extremely well proportioned; almost all your pudge went to your butt, boobs and tummy, and you certainly didnât have to worry about cellulite or cholesterol. On your body, you wore a shining set of steel plate armor. Like all armor in kinkquest, it was extremely skimpy and barely covered your body at all (even leaving your butt and belly completely exposed) yet it still somehow magically protected you from damage.

You rode along on an armored dire horse; a 10-foot tall stallion who was more than capable of bearing your heavy weight. Meanwhile, riding along beside you was a young lad, at only 19, riding on a diminutive little pony (the cheapest mount you could find). This lad was named Lucas, and for the past few months, he's been serving as your faithful squire. He was always the shy, timid type, and definitely wasn't cut out for combat; so instead of picking a combat build himself, he put all his points into Intelligence, and immediately signed up to be the apprentice and servant to a knight like yourself. You're probably the best mistress he could've ended up with, all things considered. You treated him relatively kindly and fairly, and genuinely cared about his well-being, always making sure to protect him against the dangers of Kinkquest. Sure, you do fart on him sometimes just to tease him, but you take care not to knock him out with your stench or anything. Its certainly better than what some knights do to their helpless squires...

You only have one real stipulation: he's not allowed to jerk off. Beneath his robes, his manhood is locked in a chastity cage 24/7, and you have the one and only key. Thus, whenever the poor lad gets so horny he canât take it anymore, he has to come to you on his hands and knees and beg you to get him off. You're not sadistic, though. If he begs earnestly enough, you're usually more then happy to oblige. After all, as his mistress, his pleasure is your responsibility! Besides, why would he want to clumsily pleasure himself with his own hand when he can instead thrust that adorable little cock of his between your pursed lips, or maybe grind it up and down between your big, jiggly boobs or buttcheeks, or â on special occasions â maybe even slide it right up your big booty and blow his load straight into your bowels. Truly, Lucas was a lucky squire, indeed...

So how did you ever obtain a squire of your own? Well, the second thing you did upon playing Kinkquest was sign up to be a knight. Knights had the responsibility of upholding the law in the kingdom, and neutralizing threats that have been killing too many players. It's dangerous and grueling work, but with it comes a level of nobility that you enjoyed. After all, nobody in towns would dare interfere with a knight's affairs, lest they end up at the business end of your knightly sword. Another upside of becoming a knight is that a sword, shield, armor and even your squire was assigned to you automatically, though you did have to provide your own mount. Since then, you've been constantly going on missions to slay dangerous creatures and collect the bounties on savage bandits, in order to make Kinkquest a safer place for honest adventurers. NPCs are artificial intelligences dotted around Kinkquest to make the game more interesting. While you were completely adverse to killing other players, NPCs werenât real people, so you didnât feel guilty about doing anything you wanted to them. Especially considering the fact that more and more of them seem to be spawning in with every passing dayâ¦

You and your squire travel under the cover of the Wild Woods canopy, until you see the smoke of the banditâs bonfire nearby. âAlright, donât want to get any closer than this. Wouldnât want you in harmâs way, would we sugar?â You smile to Lucas as the two of you hop off of mounts and gaze at the bandit encampment down the hill from you. Suddenly, Lucas gasps as you lift the human up by his robes, using your incredible height to hoist him up onto a nearby tree branch. âYou just climb up there and see if you can get a good view of them, okay?â Lucas had high intelligence and several skills related to analysis, so you always let him scout things out before you made your move.

Once he was high enough, he pulled out a pair of fancy binoculars, and became scouting the encampment out. âThere seems to be about five bandits. Four normal ones, one chieftainâ¦â He yelled down to you, before pausing as he analyzed the stats of each bandit. âThe normal ones have about 80 Health each, while the Chieftain has 150.â

âExcellent! So theyâre weak, then!â You smile up at him. âDo you see any ways I could sneak in?â

âHmmâ¦â He pauses for a long while, trying to come up with a good strategy. "If you want to get rid of the regular bandits first, you can sneak in through that gap in the wall there. Then again, if you want to dispatch the chieftain first, you can climb on top of that shack and sneak in through the hatch on the roof.â

You nod, considering it for a few seconds. âAlright, thanks, sugar. You just stay up there, okay? Iâll be back in a jiffy.â Without any combat stats whatsoever, Lucas was completely defenseless on his own, but fortunately most humans and monsters wouldnât be able to reach him while heâs high up in the tree. 13311.content:
Due to your size and weight, you completely lacked Agility, and thus, you werenât particularly good at sneaking around. Your build was more focused on open combat, though you were sometimes able to pick off at least one enemy before being spotted by the others. You managed to carefully slide your huge, reptilian body through a meager gap in the wall, to see that the bandits were busy celebrating a recent raid, looking over the loot theyâve acquired. All the bandits seemed to be young human men, although the chieftain seemed to be an anthropomorphic wolf of some sort. Luckily, the chieftain seemed to spend most of his time locked away inside of his hut, so you would be able to pick off his underlings without much resistance.

You snuck up behind the closest bandit, who was sitting separate from the others, sorting over his ill-gotten gains. Just as he was about to notice you sneaking up on him, you suddenly wrap a huge, muscular arm around him, and thrust your sword straight through his heart! However, the wound results in no blood whatsoever. You can tell these bandits are NPCs, because they donât bleed â instead, when they die, they simply fade away. Indeed, the bandit immediately started to disappear in your arms, but not before letting out a loud scream that alerts the others. 2x Sneak Attack Damage! Bandit loses 88 Health, and dies!

âWhat the hell?â The nearest bandit turns around at the sound, only to see you standing there, the corpse of his comrade fading away before you. Wide-eyed, he jumps out of his seat, and rushes deeper into the encampment to warn the others. âIntruder! We have an intru- ack!â Before he can make it very far, you leap forward and sink your sword into his shoulder blade! Bandit loses 41 Health!

Yelling out in fury, he spins around and tries to strike you with his iron mace! Fortunately, you were positioned in just the right way to easily block his attack with your shield. You shield deflects his attack!

Just as you finish your second kill, you roar in pain as you feel an arrow pierce through your shoulder. It was mostly absorbed by your scales and armor, but it was still rather painful. You lose 17 Health!

You rip the arrow out of your shoulder, and turn to see an archer hiding in one of the nearby huts. As the archer readies another arrow, you hide behind a nearby shack, disappearing from his sight. The archer keeps his bow ready to fire the moment you step out of coverâ¦ only to be surprised to feel you poking him on his back. Bandit loses 86 Health, and dies!

Now that that was taken care of, the encampment fell silent. You wander around, keeping your sword and shield ready, searching for the final regular bandit so you can take him out before you fight the chieftain. âThree down, just one more to go. Now, whereâd that ne'er-do-well run off to?â You said to yourself, confused by the fact that the fourth bandit seems to have completely disappeared. Suddenly, you noticed the bandit rushing into the chieftainâs hut. âUgh! What a cowardâ¦â You groaned.

âBoss! Boss! We have an intruder! Sheâs already killed everyone else!â You can faintly hear the panicked bandit say. âYouâve got to do something!â

âWhat? Alright, Iâll handle this,â a deep, brutish voice responds. Suddenly, the door of the shack is kicked open, and a robust, seven-foot tall wolf man steps out. He was wearing thick leather armor that barely covered his body, the sun shining on his rippling, muscular pecs, and his vibrant pink, 10-inch long manhood unsheathed and displayed proudly. You're almost hypnotized by his body for a moment. It was almost a shame you had to slay him â on friendlier terms, you couldâve had a lot of âfunâ with the handsome wolf. You lose 15 Willpower!

Which brings you to the one redeeming quality of a Beta Tester, if you died, you could respawn back at your starting area. Of course, respawning was also an opportunity to have you test other elements of the game. You might wake up an inch tall, or as a girl, or with a permanent Willpower of 0.

In a state of unconsciousness, a necessary part of being an unwilling test subject, you see a screen pop up, showing you what stats you had. Health was higher if only to keep you alive for longer, but, as if to spit you, Libido was one point higher than the rest...

Human Male Beta Tester
Health: 120/120
Willpower: 70/70
Strength: 5
Intelligence: 5
Charisma: 5
Agility: 5
Libido: 6
Exp: 0
Skills: None

The flash of information leaves your mind's eye as you begin to awaken. Slowly your eyes flutter open to reveal yet another downsides of being a Beta Tester. No choice of starting areas. Looking around you see...
1351.title: The Beta Tester

1352.content:
As you hit the custom input option, a representation of your avatar appears before you. You quickly set to work customizing your digital form.

It took nearly an hour of painstaking work to get it exactly how you want, but as you stepped back you were very satisfied with how it came out. Standing before you was a six and a half foot tall anthro cow woman. Short but silky soft black and white patched fur covered her from head to toe, wrapping around her voluptuous frame. Her face was sensual with plump lips, a lovely nose, and luminous green eyes, topped off by thick wavy locks of blood-red hair that cascaded around her neck and shoulders all the way to her waist. Small curled horns peaked up through the hair, and a long pair of ears stuck out from either side of her head. She had an hourglass figure, but it was definitely more weighted towards the top due to how you had given her two pairs of breasts, each a luscious mound nearly twice the size of her head. Her hips and thighs were wide and fertile looking, wrapping around into a rump that had a lot of junk in the trunk with a thin tail sticking out right above the bouncy cheeks. Sandwiched between her breasts and her legs, her stomach wasn’t spared the extra weight you had added, forming a plush little dome that was downright small compared to the neighboring body parts.

Turning your attention to the adjacent floating screen, you looked over the personal stats for your character:

Bess “Sunrise” Whitney
Health 100/100
Willpower 100/100
Strength 8
Intelligence 7
Charisma 8
Agility 7
Libido 5

Satisfied with the stats, you hit the glowing confirmation button. The stats screen vanished, and your bovine avatar suddenly turned to smoke. The cloud drifted lazily for a second before rushing over you. You couldn’t see anything for a moment, and then you were back in the white void but something seemed different now. There was something at the bottom of your vision, and when you looked you saw that it was two great furry mounds. You were now in your avatar’s body, your new digital body. You spent several moments exploring your new body: hefting all your breasts, running your fingers through the fur, and feeling the muscles buried beneath the softness. So lost in your probing that it took you several minutes to notice the new options floating in midair or the soft chiming that was supposed to attract your attention. Looking up, you saw that it was three locations, but just the names, no descriptions on any of them. You hemmed and hawed for a short before hitting one of the options, figuring what could happen.
1352.title: A new cowgirl

13521.content:
Nothing happened for a bit, making you wonder if something was wrong. Suddenly the void around you folded away like origami, revealing a blue sky dotted with white fluffy clouds. A stiff breeze blew across you ruffling your fur and causing you to shiver slightly; it felt so real. A speck appeared in the distance from behind one of the clouds, you thought it might be a bird, but it quickly got bigger and bigger. As it went roaring past you saw that it was actually a massive dragon. Looking down, you gulped, suddenly realizing where you were; you’re floating far above the ground, so far that the ground below was just a mosaic of colors laid out beneath you. A sudden sensation of falling hit you, as the clouds appeared to rise into the sky and the wind whistled in your ears as you plummeted.

A scream caught in your throat as the ground rushed up to meet you. Fucking great you managed to think just got into this bloody thing and now I’m already going to die! You screwed your eyes shut as you closed in on the ground, fully expecting to go splat…but it doesn’t happen. Instead, glowing text appeared on the inside of your eyelids, reading “Welcome to Kinkquest! You are now located in The Capital. Have fun.” The text soon faded away, and you opened your eyes and found yourself in…
13521.title: Dropping in

choices: It’s…you’re not actually sure what it is.
135211.content:
You found yourself in a busy marketplace, throngs of people crowding around the smaller stalls and mingling with the comings and goings from the larger stores around the central square. Many different types of folks were packed into the space: humans, other anthros, more fantasy style races, and some you couldn’t even begin to recognize. Dotted throughout the heaving masses, you could even see public displays of sex going on. One notable case very close to you was a four-way involving what appeared to be a no more than 12 year old fox who was so fat that he was nearly spherical sandwiched between an angel and a succubus, topped off with a non-anthro horse braced across the other three . It took several tries before you were able to tear your eyes off of the spectacle completely.

On a raised platform on one end of the square, you saw a row of pillories with most of them filled. You were thinking there was nothing odd about that bit at least: medieval like town with people tossed in for public abuse. You saw a small sign attached to the platform, with the words “Public-use pillories” written on the rough wood. That’s when you noticed that all of the people in the pillories were naked, and the people around them were performing various sexual acts on the prisoners. Some were being taken from behind, others from the front, and more than a few were being taken from both directions at the same time. One – a plump little human except for the pointy fox ears poking through her hair – was being worked over by four people at the same time, including one at her ears.

Turning away again, only now did you think to wonder how exactly you were dressed. With your inflated figure, you couldn’t exactly see much of your own body. Fortunately, there was a mirror propped against a nearby stand. Making your way through the crowd, you looked yourself over once you could see your reflection. It was better than you were fearing, but worse than you were hoping: you weren’t naked, but quite close. Your torso was “covered” with a simple linen blouse that was pulled taut around your body and had a plunging neckline that exposed much of your upper pair of breasts and a good portion of the lower pair, as well as a high hem that left a portion of your plush belly uncovered. Your “pants” were more like a skimpy pair of short-shorts, hugging your wide hips and thighs and dipping low around the top of your big ass.

“Hmm…aren’t you beautiful?” you heard a voice murmur right next to you, breaking you out of your visual exploration of yourself

Spinning around, you stumbled away from the speaker.
135211.title: The carnal mart

choices: ...gather me some firewood from just outside the city!"
13531.content:
Many different careers could be built within the world of Kinkquest, but one sprang to your mind. A master of preparation and weaponry, unparalleled in skill and knowledge of the wilds...a hunter! In this game you plan to live the life of luxury, with a fortune made on the biggest of game hunts! You begin by choosing a noble elf as your race, starting at the Capital so you can be well prepared before taking your first target!

Erin the Elf
Male
Health: 100/100
Willpower: 100/100
Strength: 10
Intelligence: 5
Charisma: 7
Agility: 10
Libido: 0
Exp: 0
Skills:
Tracking: Level 1.
Knowledge Nature: Level 1.

You awake in a starting tavern, and get the low down on all the controls. You begin with basic leather armour, a backpack and a few rations...but nothing else. You need weapons, maps and other supplies. You'll need some money before any of that will come to pass. There are protections in place in the game so that new players don't immediately get pounced on, so you have some time to look around for what you want. As an elf you have a natural tendency for archery, but you're not going to rule out melee weapons if you need them. You're about to leave the tavern when you see exactly how you look! A wonderfully slim and sleek elf boy with deep blue eyes. "Wow...this game is like...life!" You smile and admire yourself...
"ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED: NARCISSIST"

You get the message and get a move on! You hit the streets and admire the countless colourful people...humans, anthros, monsters, funny little pokeemen? A few girls were already giving you the eye, some men too! It was nice to be admired. You already had the narcissism achievement, no going back on that front! In fact, someone was already approaching you. A lioness in iron plate was striding up to you in the middle of the street. "So you're a newbie? Are you getting everything ok? No VR sickness?" She draped a long furred arm around your shoulder. "I'm level 5, so I could help you out if you follow me around, I have all sorts of fun!" You feel nervous, but your charisma boosts your natural nerves somewhat. "That'd be great, but I just wanna experience things myself." She looks disappointed, but then smiles. "Sure thing! I'll see you around elf boy!" She turns, her tail raising up and brushing your face as she leaves. What was that about? You didn't realize these players might be so...kinky!

Your first trip was to the armory. A ox-bone bow was the starting weapon, and making it your starting weapon allowed you to pick up skills in archery and crafting arrows and poisons. The Minotaur behind the counter sees you eyeing it up. "Hehe! Hey there adventurer! Elf wants a bow, huh?" You nod. "Yes sir! How much for it?" The weaponsmith explains that starting weapons can be paid for by a simple fetch quest, since getting money at low levels is harder. "Yes sir!" The jolly tauren laughs and slaps your back. "That's what I like to here! Now, adventurer, your first quest is to..."
13531.title: Character Slot

choices: You go it alone and find the bank.
You go it alone and get lost.
You can't shake the woman, and accept her offer.
135312.content:
Sounds simple enough, you think, while the smithy rifles through shelves beneath the counter. He passes to you a box wrapped in parcel paper with the bank's address on it. It seems to be for "Ms.Cherry". Delivering a package isn't very heroic but you have to start somewhere. The Minotaur leans in to you and whispers. "If I'm honest newbie, I usually give the starting quest where they have to venture into the sewer and collect rat pelts, but I like you!" His breath reeks, and it's only now you realize how potent the game's smell simulation is. He continues. "So, make sure that you deliver this personally to Ms.Cherry. And tell her that she's welcome to another one if she meets our arrangement." His dire tone was a little suspicious, but you still smile. "Alright, I won't let it out of my sight until it's in Ms.Cherry's hands!" The Minotaur ruffles your hair and lets you go on your way, and you step back onto the street.

You hold the box in both hands and wander for a moment, it's reaching mid-day now and the people are coming out to eat and socialize. A map is in the town square just a short walk from the blacksmith, you mutter to yourself while you peruse it to locate the bank. You don't even notice a person is creeping up behind you. A familiar arm wraps around your shoulder, making you jump! You look to see the lioness again, smiling at you. "Hey again cutie! Look at you! On a little quest?" This woman is making you feel a little uncomfortable. "Yeah...just trying to find the bank to deliver this package." She scoots to your side and pretends to read the map with you. "Hmm...well these streets are designed to be confusing to help players get attuned to navigation skills. A newb like you could easily get lost and who knows what shady characters you'd bump into!" You're now seeing the benefit of high charisma, you can talk circles around anyone! You're finding it hard to tell her to buzz off! "I'd just hate to see something happen to a boy like you, so why don't you let me escort you to the bank, keep you safe..." She extends a hand to you ,but have a bad feeling about this, but this map isn't helping much either...
135312.title: ...deliver this package to the bank!"

choices: Another player, looking for his friend
13532.content:
When given the opportunity to set their own destiny, some aspire to be great heroes. Others fashion themselves leaders of cities and nations. Things hardly ever go as planned, and for all the lofty goals you had when starting the game, becoming a feared and notorious bandit was not one. Your adventure started in the Wild Woods, but through an unusual ally you were sent down the way of dastardly deeds. When you realized being the bad guy of the story could be this much fun, you embraced it with both arms.

Tankred the Terrifying
Strength: 12
Intelligence: 13
Charisma: 4
Agility: 26
Libido: 8
-Skills-
Archery III
Archery I (unlocked): You have become more adept at using a bow than most. You can land shots from greater range with greater accuracy.
Archery II (unlocked): You have learned how to account for every aspect of your surroundings, allowing you to always hit a target at shorter ranges as well as shoot specific limbs from longer ranges. You can now also use a bow whilst mounted
Archery III (unlocked): You have mastered shooting with staggering accuracy while mounted, no longer suffering any penalties, regardless of the speed at which the mount is running.
Archery IV (locked): The bow holds no secrets for you anymore. On foot, you can pin a cherry to a tree from 200 feet away. While mounted, you can hit any part of a target with pinpoint accuracy.

Fletching III
Fletching I (unlocked): You know how to craft and maintain basic bows and arrows. You can also upgrade most basic bows to make them a little more accurate.
Fletching II (unlocked): You've learned how to add custom tips to your arrows, allowing you to create poisonous, fluid and gas arrows, used to strike targets with any poison, fluid or gas of choice. Regular arrows now have a good chance to pierce most light armors, ignoring their defense. Bows you craft are more precise and able to fire with greater power.
Fletching III (unlocked): You can expertly maintain any bow, augmenting their damage and accuracy. You can use exotic materials to craft bows and arrows with unusual properties, depending on the material. Your basic arrows can puncture some medium armor, ignoring their defense. Fluid and Gas arrows can now be fitted with miniature explosive charges to spread their payload over a wider area.
Fletching IV (locked): You can craft a bow out of practically anything and maintain any bow in the game in perfect condition. Your crafted arrows fly true even in difficult conditions and can pierce all light and medium armors, ignoring their defense. Your crafted bows far exceed any regular bow in power, accuracy and firing speed.

Touch of Nature I
Touch of Nature I (unlocked): You have an above average understanding of plants and animals around you. You can identify specific plants more easily and track most animals. You can also read an animal's body language well enough to gain a basic understanding of their intentions.
Touch of Nature II (locked): Your knowledge of the wild allows you to identify any plant and animal. You can commune with animals to a very basic extent, allowing you to more effectively soothe of scare them.
Touch of Nature III (locked): You can communicate with animals well enough to crudely converse with them. Your knowledge of plants allows you a resistance to most natural poisons.

Poison Expertise II
Poison Expertise I (unlocked): You can create basic poisons for blades and arrows. Your poisons are able to wound, slow and knockout their targets, though they take some time to be effective.
Poison Expertise II (unlocked): Your repertoire of poisons grows, allowing you to create silencing, arousing and berserking poisons. The effects of your poisons are more potent and act faster. You can now poison greatswords and axes of any size too.
Poison Expertise III (locked): You can hone your poisons to greater effect, allowing you to put a delay on them. Delayed poisons are unnoticeable for a set amount of time after being administered. The effects of your poisons are stronger and take effect almost immediately. Your can apply poison to blunt weapons.
Poison Expertise IV (locked): You know precisely how to mix a poison for almost any effect or combination thereof. Your poisons take effect the moment they are delivered to their target and can be put on nearly any weapon.


Your plan of becoming a master archer and ranger of the wilds started as most did, gaining levels hunting the beasts the Wild Woods provided. You learned much about your weapon and surroundings, growing adept at maintaining your bow as well as crafting custom arrows for it. You didn't play Kinkquest just to be a pure and good beacon of hope though. Those points in Libido weren't there for show. Whenever you did venture into town to resupply you spent a considerable amount of your earnings on women. It was all in good fun until one of them drugged you and took you to the Capital Alteration Lab. You woke up the next day penniless in a back alley. To your horror you discovered you had been given the body of an anthro skunk, a long bushy tail now adorning your rear and black and white fur covering your body. With only the rags on your body remaining you head out into the wilds once more, bitter and angry at this cruel twist of fate.

The hunt changed for you. Beasts of the wild didn't carry the same thrill anymore, and NPC bandits were plenty. You became a hunter of men as much as beasts, quickly learning to adapt your newfound skills to your benefit. Honing your craft allowed you to create ammo using your own skunk spray, allowing you to deliver your foulest stink from long range. Soon you had picked up the art of turning the beasts you killed into powerful poisons to incapacitate your prey in various ways. With a smile on your face you would see your targets fall down with paralysis or go mad with berserking rage, turning on their comrades. When all was done you took an almost perverse pleasure in personally ending the paralyzed bandits with your foul farts and spray. Your dreams of heroism grew ever more distant as the bandits in the woods began to replace the animals as your prey of choice. The final straw was the moment you met Bandero

During one of your many hunts you came across a small cave with baleful howling echoing from within. Whatever creature was in there was in great pain, it's cries for help cutting through your very soul. When you got close enough you saw the largest stink wolf you've ever seen being kicked and beaten by a human player. The player's weapons were discarded nearby, he was prolonging this fight for his own sick pleasures. His idiotic chuckling as he kicked the downed wolf in the head made your blood boil. With righteous fury to put three arrows in the back of his head, the first killing him on the spot with the remaining two in there just for good measure. The wounded beast looked up to see what mysterious creature its saviour was. When you got close it growled a little before finally calming down. You tended its wounds as best you could and over the next few weeks you nursed the beast back to full health. You had taken to calling him Bandero, on account of you thought it fitted for the great wolf. You had no idea why it was a little larger than a horse, but it didn't seem to bother the stench wolf in any way. Your affinity with nature and the weeks spent around Bandero also made you completely immune to his stink. When he was free to roam the wilds once again, the great stench wolf looked you in the eye and resolutely walked to you, sitting down beside you. You had made a friend for life, and immediately you saw an opportunity.

It cost you an arm and a leg, but you had a custom saddle built for Bandero, both so you could ride on his back and to protect him a little. Though hesitant at first, the stench wolf proved a great mount, helping you chase down your targets. His size made him a very effective Gasser mount to boot. In no time at all he'd learned how to incapacitate and even kill with his potent farts and belches. Furthermore he picked up the Voracity talents, allowing him to swallow humanoid prey whole with ease. The bond between you grew as you took on bandits and players alike. When a Knight, a player who took an oath to take down notorious player killers, was added to this stack of victims, you knew this was the life you wanted. Let those good-hearted fools muck about in their big cities. But should they dare venture into your woods, they would soon meet the infamous Tankred the Terrifying.

The day had only just started and already you were in a good mood. A foolhardy newbie had charged you and was now lying on the ground before you, poison coursing through his veins and numbing his muscles. You had stripped him naked, rifling through his belongings for some rations or anything of value. Bandero stood nearby, whimpering a little to get your attention. You look up to see his huge puppy eyes looking down at the writhing player, then back at you. With a big smile you nod, allowing the horse-sized stench wolf to deal with the player. With only a few throaty gulps he swallowed the man whole and alive. Suddenly a sound catches your ear. You rub your hands together in delight, that sounded like...
13532.title: Tankred the Terrifying

choices: You come across an NPC bandit camp
135321.content:
"Mike?! Where the fuck did you go?"

Your smile curled up from ear to ear. The noob currently occupying the belly of your mount has a friend. And given that Bandero swallowed him whole, he's probably still visible for his friend on the game map. You grab your things and jump into the saddle, preparing your bow for a nice introduction. As the player comes around the corner he's still staring at the map in his hands, completely oblivious to his surroundings. Only when Bandero growls a little does he look up. He turns pale at the sight of you, sitting on top of a stench wolf the size of a large horse. You see the basic scraps of leather armor he's wearing and the dinky little blades of a rogue with little experience on his belt. With all the courage he can muster, the player tucks away the map and boldly asks:

"Eh.. hi. Have you seen Mike? He's another player like me. Longsword, shitty gear, low level..."

"Yeah, I've seen him." You reply with an evil smirk. "He's right here." You pat Bandero's side to illustrate your point. But where you expected fear from the noob in front of you, he only sighed deeply and buried his face in his palms.

"Let me guess... he charged right at you, didn't he? I do apologize, he's still new at games. He's not quite understood the concept of levels. Is there any chance I could convince you to have your mount regurgitate him before he dies? Should be a good lesson not to attack everything in sight..."

"Now why would I do that? I've got a much better idea. Bandero here is a big wolf, so one noob might not be enough. And as a bonus you get to tell your friend yourself how dumb he is."

The noob cursed his friend under his breath. They were gonna have to respawn together and work their way back into the game after this. With a sigh he drew his daggers. "Welp, let's get this over with. No point running away..."

"Indeed." You chime in gleefully. "Although he does like it when his prey runs. Chasing them down is such fun."

The noob carefully approached you, daggers at the ready. He needed to get in striking range if he wanted to leave any kind of impression. His health started trickling down as he got near Bandero, the great stench wolf's natural foul scent doing its work. You committed yourself to sitting back, letting your mount pick the best way to deal with this. Just before the rogue could strike, the wolf lunged forward, headbutting him for a modest chunk of damage. The two rusty daggers went flying out of his hands and the man landed on his back. Bandero quickly bounded forward, standing tall over his downed prey and lining himself up. You heard the noob's pained groan below you and realized your mount was about to sit down on him. You grab hold of the saddle to maintain your balance as the stench wolf plants his butt down on the man's face. The sheer weight of the butt-slam dealt a lot of damage to him, his health bar getting dangerously low and ticking down even faster now that the wolf's large butthole is directly mashed against his face. You wondered if it was going to be the stench that would kill him or something else.

PFFFFRRRT

A short and loud fart answered your question. The rogue went from squirming to twitching manically for a few seconds before going limp. You almost pity the man, meeting his doom by wolf farts. He also wouldn't be able to tell his friend what a moron he was. Though judging by the amount of time that had passed, there was a good chance Bandero's belly had ended him already. The great wolf yipped with glee as a glowing aura surrounded him for a moment. He had gained a level up. You let the wolf pick his skills himself and Bandero immediately leveled up his Voracity with another point, allowing him to hold more prey in his belly and heal instantly whenever he dealt damage to any living prey inside of him. Additionally he had spent enough points in this tree to unlock another method of ingestion and feeling the man's face press against his pucker, the choice was obvious.

You heard a strange slurping noise and jumped off your mount to see what was going on. You trusted Bandero to deal with his own levels instead of picking them for him. He stood up a little bit, revealing the source of the strange noise as the dead rogue's head was pulled completely into the wolf's asshole. The great wolf had learned the Anal Vore skill, allowing him to pull enemies into his butt and send them to his bowels for digestion. He sat down again, pushing most of the rogue's torso in. You quickly snuck your hand in there to grab the man's belt before it disappeared into the wolf forever. Tied to his belt were some herbs and a small pouch of coins. It wasn't much, but at least you were able to salvage some loot from this encounter. (12 gold coins, 1 medicinal herb looted)

Bandero stood and grunted, sucking the last of his prey inside of his ass. His big belly gurgled and rumbled, getting to work on the two noobs. You spend the next hour taking another short nap and playing with him. You conclude playtime by ruffling his fur and telling him he's a good boy. He responds by licking your face with enough vigor to knock you over. With the noobs all but digested you hop into the saddle and ride off, looking for adventure.
135321.title: Another player, looking for his friend

choices: Shoot a skunk or gas arrow at the Knight
1353212.content:
You ride down the road at good speed. Gassing and killing lowbies was fun and all, but it didn't get you much in the way of experience or loot anymore. Thankfully the game had a solid smattering of villages for players who choose the bandit life, offering many exciting quests to steal and plunder. One such den of thieves was down the road before you, a few minutes' journey at most. But long before the town gates came into view another player stood ahead, calling out to you.

"Halt!"

Before you stood a Knight, a player who took an oath to take down bandit players and bring justice to the land. You'd fought off one before and this one looked like a challenge too. She was clad in shimmering metal armor from head to toe. It gleamed in the sun like a radiant beacon. She must need the benefits of being a knight solely to pay for armor polish. Her shield was just as polished, but showed its many scars of battle. Dents and scrapes from every weapon imaginable. The thick plate was more than a match for your arrows. Her weapon of choice was a vicious looking flail. A hit from that looked like it could inflict some serious damage. You couldn't tell if it was attached to the horse's saddle or her back, but just behind her was a banner proudly displaying a flag. You didn't recognize the symbols on it as any law enforcement or order of knights you had ever heard of. Probably her guild banner or something. From behind her visor you could just about spot her intense glare. It actually felt a little intimidating.

Riding up just behind the Knight was her squire. You knew well why many players liked to play a knight, as the main perk was your very own squire. You could order him or her to do just about anything that wasn't illegal. And in Kinkquest, that meant these squires were often used as sex slaves. Who knew what kinky deeds this beacon of justice would get up to after dark? To her credit, she had at least not dressed him up in a gimp suit or anything like that. You'd heard many tales of knights who unabashedly showed off their squires as the sex toys they saw them as. The squire rode a small horse, looking almost laughable next to the muscular steed of his master. His garb was basic cloth and his weapon seemed to be absent. The saddlebags on his horse told another story. In them you could spot all manner of weapon, probably for the knight to use. You're also quite certain you saw a flash of pink, shaped not unlike a dildo. Perhaps this knight wasn't so different after all.

"Stand down and face justice, bandit! Surrender yourself to me and I will show you mercy!" Her commanding tone sent a shiver down your spine. She sure was confident.

"Has that ever worked on anyone?" You ask condescendingly.

"No, but it allows me to go all in on your ass!" She replied with a smile. At least you think she's smiling, the visor on her helmet is making it hard to see. You throw up your hands, conceding that she had a point there.

A fight is inevitable. She's getting ready to charge at you. You look down at your options. Her warhorse was imposing, but Bandero was far from puny himself. His superior agility could probably see him jump up to knock her out of the saddle. Similarly you had your bow to hand. Piercing her armor would be damn near impossible, but your mastery of creating custom arrows left you with some useful options. An arrow loaded with knockout gas or your skunk spray could prove very effective at tilting the odds in your favour before she even reaches you. What do you do?
1353212.title: A knight blocks your path

choices: The Knight uses a spell to cleanse her armor
The Knight removes the affected armor and charges again
13532121.content:
Your skills leaned towards ranged combat and your arsenal of special arrows would see you through this fight. The Knight was eager to close the gap and introduce her heavy flail to your face. With a thundering gallop she charged for you. Her flail swung overhead, ready to slap down your health bar. You reach down and grab an arrow from Bandero's saddlebags. The distinct color of the fletchings told you this was a Skunk Arrow. The tip of it wasn't point, but a small glass bulb. Inside a thick orange fluid swirled around. Harvesting your own spray had been messy work, but these arrows packed a punch few could see coming. You line up a shot and aim right at the Knight's face. She didn't respond at all, making no efforts to raise her shield. Did that visor really make it that difficult to see what you were doing? Or was she confident in her armor's ability to stop all arrows. Either way, she was about to receive a nasty surprise.

With a sharp thwip the arrow came sailing towards her, connecting with her face long before she could react to the revelation that this arrow was not designed to pierce her armor.The glass bulb shattered and released it's foul payload all over her helmet and chestplate. Immediately her charge began to veer off course as the potent skunk spray surprised and disoriented her. Her knockout meter would be building up fast whilst it did tiny amounts of damage to boot. More importantly, you and Bandero leaned to the side and watched the flail's spiked head whiz by. Despite not hitting you, seeing the fearsome weapon up close was still quite scary. Angrily, the Knight swung her weapon in your general direction, but again she missed. A third swing found it's mark, but she'd barely been able to put her strength behind the blow. Nonetheless the flail managed to leave a painful mark on your leg. (-15 HP)

If such a weak hit could take off that much health, you couldn't afford to let her strike you at full strength. info.brief_description: A brand new kinky game that totally isn't evil or nefarious in any way!
info.description:
Welcome to Kinkquest! The brand new VR adult game brought to you by DefinitelyNotEvil inc.! We hope you enjoy your experience with this unique and fun filled world!

Now, game intro out of the way, in this interactive, you're a person who just bought a brand new adult game. Thing is, when you play it, you're actually trapped inside! And about 90% of the game's inhabitants want the player as a mate, a slave, a prize, a pet, furniture, or even food! Your objective is to find a way out before any of these things happen! (Spoiler alert: there IS no way out.)

In this world, just about any creature you can imagine exists. Monsters, furries, anthro and feral Pokemon, dinosaurs, tentacle monsters, horny plants, everything! And most of them want YOU!

Now, as this is a video game, there are stats and stuff! The most important two are Willpower and Health. If the former drops to zero, you no longer have the will to resist your opponent. If your health drops to zero...you die. Now, while dying obviously results in a game over, a loss of will might not. Should an enemy let you go, your will is replenished, but the maximum is dropped by ten.

The other stats, Charisma, Strength, Intelligence, Libido, and Agility affect various things about your character.

Charisma lets you charm your way into, or out of, someone's pants, or just glean info from them.

Strength is how physically tough you are, and how hard you hit things.

Intelligence positively affects how fast your willpower regenerates, and how easily you can be tricked.

Libido negatively affects how fast your willpower regenerates. A higher libido over intelligence makes your willpower drain constantly.

Agility affects how fast you are, and how well you dodge things.

In addition to stats, you also have various skills. All of these skills start at zero, but you can improve one for every ten exp you get. What skills are there, you ask? Anything you can think of! However, they all have to revolve around some kind of kink!

You can also change your physical body to something else at the Alteration lab in the main hub city. However, it's a process that only works once, so choose wisely.

Experience points are earned for doing just about anything! Walking long distances, buying things, learning things, winning fights, losing fights. They don't all award the same amount of course!

Starting locations: There are three, but feel free to add more to the game!


The main hub city, known just as The Capital, is pretty much the only place to buy gear, and chat with civilized folk. Anything you can think of can be found here, but there are still some unsavory individuals lurking about.

The Wild Woods is an uncharted place where all manner of beasts lurk. Do not linger here for long, lest you end up sniffing wolf farts for the rest of your life!

White-Coat mountain is home to various, hardy creatures. A temple resides at the top, where the people go to worship the great Nine-Tailed kitsune whom evereyone reveres as the world's goddess. You may wish to steer clear...if you make one wrong statement in the temple, you'll be bound as the Goddess' footslave for life!

And finally...kinks. I'm allowing everything other than scat and gore. Anything else you want...go for it!

Now...have fun!
